events.name: First Azure Community Singapore Meetup: An Introduction
events.description: Hi All, I would like to invite you to join this Azure Community in Singapore. We will be having the first meetup on February 10. If you want to meet the Microsoft Azure experts, masters, developers, Microsoft MVPs and wants to be friends with them and can learn/share knowledge, than this is the place to be. Come and join this first meetup and bring your friends as well so you be able to know the Azure community member in Singapore. Here is the Agenda for the meetup: + Opening : Introduction of the community and members. + What is cloud? What is the difference with normal hosting? What is IaaS, PaaS, SaaS. + How to create Microsoft Azure account : And get a free USD200 credits to spend on all Azure services. + Introduction to Microsoft Azure: Cloud ecosystem and portal navigation. + Azure at a glance for Developers : I'm a developer (.NET, Java, Node.js, PHP, etc.), what should I do to use Azure? + Create my own WordPress blogger in the cloud . My server, my database, my control. + Q&A and Closing WiFi: Free Food and Drinks: Available (Thanks to Microsoft Singapore as the sponsor for the food) Yayyyy...!!! There will be a door prize from unnamed sponsor (not Microsoft) for one lucky member. Join this community, RSVP and come on our first meetup. The door prize is one: " Raspberry PI 2 Model B " which can run the free Windows 10 . To participate: As pointed by the sponsor, the member must already have Microsoft Azure Account and we will ask one simple question on Azure related. Bring your friends to join this community. Let's have fun in the cloud.
events.location: 22CF12, Level 22, Microsoft Singapore, Singapore 018989, One Marina Boulevard

events.name: Creative Crew Talks - February Meeting 2015
events.description:
An Event for People Who Love to be Inspired 
Creative Crew Singapore is a non-profit organisation devoted to spear the development of the local community for greater learning.  We explore the learning evolution - learn unique experiences with tools or stories to give shape to ideas, and what are the trends that will shape how you'll work and think.  
We hold a series of talks and workshops by some of the brightest minds from design, development, experience and technology. 
  
 Photos credit to Peter Lim   

An evening on Digital Painting and Sketching 
  
Programme Details 
  
Fast sketching and storytelling 
by Preetam Rai
 
Whiteboard, markers and Post-its are probably the simplest media we can utilize to illustrate our ideas. Join us as we explore how we can use such humble objects to convey ideas and encourage participation in a meeting or discussion. We will explore fast sketching and storytelling.
  
Using the iPad for digital sketching and painting with Procreate App
 by Ivan Chew
 
Ivan will share how he uses the iPad for sketching and painting. Specifically, he will talk about what he has learned using an app called Procreate, highlighting its features and some application of digital art techniques.
  
Tracing and painting in Adobe Illustrator
by Leon LIm
 
Leon will share convert a bitmap image into a vector object using the Live Trace feature. He will also show some of the tools that you can use in Adobe Illustrator to paint your artwork.
  

  
Meet Our Speakers 
  
  
  
Preetam Rai 
 
Preetam Rai is an educator, he runs peer learning events across Asia.  He has helps organisations connect better with their audiences via online and offline outreach platforms. He spends time between Japan and South East Asia researching technology trends. 
  
 
Ivan Chew 
Ivan Chew is a artist, musician, former librarian-turned-entrepreneur. He currently runs a boutique media studio. As a volunteer with Creative Commons Singapore, Ivan believes in creative and social collaboration. He has a band that publishes their music exclusively under CC licences. 
  
Leon Lim 
 
Leon has been using Adobe Photoshop since version 4.0. He has been working closely with the colour laser printing industry since 2003. His expertise is on heat transfer printing onto various substrates which includes both fabric and non fabric materials. He uses both Adobe Photoshop and Adobe Illustrator in his work on a daily basis. 
  
  
  

  

 

Who should attend? This talk is suitable for anyone who want to learn and meet awesome people. 
  
Where is the talks held in the Toa Payoh Public Library? We are located at Level 1, Programme Zone 
 
 
  

 
 

Admission Rules 
It's a Free Seating Event. 
Networking with speakers will commence after the event. 
  
Duration: 
Approx 2 hrs  
  
Venue: 
6 Toa Payoh Central Singapore 319191 
  
How to get there: Nearest MRT Station : Toa Payoh Nearest Bus Interchange : Toa Payoh Central Buses : SBS Transit 56, 105, 153, 232 via Toa Payoh Central SBS Transit 8, 26, 28, 31, 73, 88, 90, 139, 142, 143, 145, 155, 157, 159,  163, 231, 235, 238 via Toa Payoh Interchange 
  
Like us on Facebook 
  
  
Meet the Sponsor
events.location: Toa Payoh Public Library, Programme Zone, 6 Toa Payoh Central, Singapore 319191

events.name: Come together, write code, join me
events.description: Hackathon, any ocaml-related project of your choice. Laptop, quiet place and coding mood. Meet fellow OCaml programmers to exchange experience or ask for help. Can share your project here to recruit developers :) I personally will be working on adding unicode support to OCaml runtime on windows.
events.location: O'Coffee Club (Harbourfront Centre), 1 Maritime square #01-65/66, Singapore
